title: China sends 7th Chinese medical team to B.P. Koirala Memorial Cancer Hospital in Nepal
description: The Chinese government (Hebei Province) has been sending medical teams to Nepal every two years since 1999. The 7th medical team consisting of 14 people arrived in Nepal on March 6, 2012. The team was stationed at B.P. Koirala Memorial Cancer Hospital. The work was handed over to the 8th medical team in February 2014.   The Chinese medical team is stationed at the B.P. Koirala Memorial Cancer Hospital, which is located in Bharatpur. Its exact locational coordinates are available at https://www.google.com/maps/place/B.P+Koirala+Memorial+Cancer+Hospital/@27.6634881,84.4187542,15z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x0:0x83afc90622a1209sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjsnfXghYbpAhWcgnIEHUanDZ8Q_BIwCnoECBYQCg.
staff_comments: The B.P. Koirala Memorial Cancer Hospital is a comprehensive cancer care center with 450 beds and equipped with diagnostic and therapeutic machines in the country. It was established in the 1990s with financial aid from China.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China sends 7th Chinese medical team to B.P. Koirala Memorial Cancer Hospital in Nepal

# Description
The Chinese government (Hebei Province) has been sending medical teams to Nepal every two years since 1999. The 7th medical team consisting of 14 people arrived in Nepal on March 6, 2012. The team was stationed at B.P. Koirala Memorial Cancer Hospital. The work was handed over to the 8th medical team in February 2014.   The Chinese medical team is stationed at the B.P. Koirala Memorial Cancer Hospital, which is located in Bharatpur. Its exact locational coordinates are available at https://www.google.com/maps/place/B.P+Koirala+Memorial+Cancer+Hospital/@27.6634881,84.4187542,15z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x0:0x83afc90622a1209sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjsnfXghYbpAhWcgnIEHUanDZ8Q_BIwCnoECBYQCg.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare services with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Medical team deployment to cancer hospital, healthcare focus

title: Chinese Government donates RMB 800,000 worth of office equipment to the Research Center of Nepal National Trust for Nature Conservation (Linked to Project ID#38366)
description: On May 8, 2014, the Chinese Government donated modern office equipment -- including DVD players, computers, scanners, and projectors -- worth over RMB 800,000 to the Research Center of Nepal National Trust for Nature Conservation (NTNC). Chinese Ambassador to Nepal, Wu Chuntai, and Secretary-General of the NTNC, Govinda Gajurel, later signed a "Delivery and Acceptance Certificate of China-aided Office Equipment'" in Kathmandu. This donation resulted from a grant agreement that was codified in letters of exchange, which were signed by the two governments in August 2012. Prior to this donation, the Chinese Government provided a grant for the construction of the Research Center of the NTNC (see Project ID#38366).  The Research Center of Nepal National Trust for Nature Conservation (NTNC) is located in Kathmandu. More detailed locational information can be found at https://www.google.com/maps/place/National+Trust+For+Nature+Conservation/@27.6575556,85.1872768,11z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x39eb176268151cc5:0xcf139fbfa2cd9617!8m2!3d27.6575556!4d85.3273525.
combined_text:
# Sector
GENERAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION

# Title
Chinese Government donates RMB 800,000 worth of office equipment to the Research Center of Nepal National Trust for Nature Conservation (Linked to Project ID#38366)

# Description
On May 8, 2014, the Chinese Government donated modern office equipment -- including DVD players, computers, scanners, and projectors -- worth over RMB 800,000 to the Research Center of Nepal National Trust for Nature Conservation (NTNC). Chinese Ambassador to Nepal, Wu Chuntai, and Secretary-General of the NTNC, Govinda Gajurel, later signed a "Delivery and Acceptance Certificate of China-aided Office Equipment'" in Kathmandu. This donation resulted from a grant agreement that was codified in letters of exchange, which were signed by the two governments in August 2012. Prior to this donation, the Chinese Government provided a grant for the construction of the Research Center of the NTNC (see Project ID#38366).  The Research Center of Nepal National Trust for Nature Conservation (NTNC) is located in Kathmandu. More detailed locational information can be found at https://www.google.com/maps/place/National+Trust+For+Nature+Conservation/@27.6575556,85.1872768,11z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x39eb176268151cc5:0xcf139fbfa2cd9617!8m2!3d27.6575556!4d85.3273525.
justification: Project involves donation of office equipment to a nature conservation research center, with no direct environmental impact or energy transition implications
evidence: Donation of office equipment (computers, projectors, etc.) to support research center operations

title: China donates books to school to Nepal
description: On March 1, 2012, Chinese Ambassador Yang Houlan donated a batch of introductory books on China on behalf of the Chinese government to a primary and secondary school in the northern mountains.
staff_comments: The exact english translation of the school's name is unknown, in one Chinese Embassy source it is reported as '加林山卡中小学' and in the other as '卡利纳格中小学'.

title: China Eximbank provides 116.13 million loan for 50 MW Upper Marsyandgi A Hydroelectric Power Plant Project
description: In 2010, a project company (special purpose vehicle) called Sinohydro-Sagarmatha Power Company (P) Ltd. — that is 90% owned by Sinohydro and 10% owned by Sagarmatha Power (P) Ltd.(Nepal) — was established for the purpose of financing, designing, implementing, and maintaining the 50 MW Upper Marsyandgi A Hydroelectric Power Plant. This run-of-river project is located in the Bhulbhule VDC of Lamjung district with the Gandaki Zone, which is 180 km away from Kathmandu. It involved the construction of the dam site, a 5 km tunnel, and a powerhouse. It also involved the installation of two turbines of 25 megawatts each and the construction of a 20 km, 132 KV single circuit transmission line from the powerhouse in Bhulbhule to Mid-Marsyangdi. On December 10, 2012, the signing ceremony was held for the strategic cooperation agreement between the Export-Import Bank of China and China Power Construction Corporation and the BOOT project financing agreement for the Shangmaxiangdi A Hydropower Station in Nepal. The total cost of the 50 MW Upper Marsyandgi Hydroelectric Power Plant Project was $165.9 million and it was financed according to a 70:30 debt-to-equity ratio. China Eximbank was the only lender for this project. Therefore, AidData assumes that the face value of the China Eximbank loan was $116.13 million. The borrowing terms of the loan were as follows: 6% interest rate, 4 year grace period, and 15 year maturity.   This project was implemented as an independent power project (IPP) on a build, own, operate and transfer (BOOT) model basis. Sinohydro-Sagarmatha Power Company (P) Ltd. signed a Power Purchase Agreement (PPA) with the Nepal Electricity Authority to provide annual power generation of approximately 317 million kWh. Sinohydro (later renamed PowerChina) was the EPC contractor responsible for project implementation. Construction began on January 8, 2013. This IPP reached its commercial operation date on January 1, 2017. Per the terms of the PPA, the NEA will off-take electricity at 6.95 Nepali rupees (Rs) per unit. The electricity produced by the Upper Marsyandgi A hydroelectric power plant will be connected to the transmission line of NEA located at Damauli. Each year, it is expected that the project will generate 317.6 million units of electricity including 57 million units between mid-December to mid-March in dry season and 260.6 million units in rainy season.
staff_comments: 1. The Chinese project title is 上马相迪A水电站 or 相迪水电站项目 or 尼泊尔上马相迪A水电站BOOT项目.
combined_text:
# Sector
ENERGY

# Title
China Eximbank provides 116.13 million loan for 50 MW Upper Marsyandgi A Hydroelectric Power Plant Project

# Description
In 2010, a project company (special purpose vehicle) called Sinohydro-Sagarmatha Power Company (P) Ltd. — that is 90% owned by Sinohydro and 10% owned by Sagarmatha Power (P) Ltd.(Nepal) — was established for the purpose of financing, designing, implementing, and maintaining the 50 MW Upper Marsyandgi A Hydroelectric Power Plant. This run-of-river project is located in the Bhulbhule VDC of Lamjung district with the Gandaki Zone, which is 180 km away from Kathmandu. It involved the construction of the dam site, a 5 km tunnel, and a powerhouse. It also involved the installation of two turbines of 25 megawatts each and the construction of a 20 km, 132 KV single circuit transmission line from the powerhouse in Bhulbhule to Mid-Marsyangdi. On December 10, 2012, the signing ceremony was held for the strategic cooperation agreement between the Export-Import Bank of China and China Power Construction Corporation and the BOOT project financing agreement for the Shangmaxiangdi A Hydropower Station in Nepal. The total cost of the 50 MW Upper Marsyandgi Hydroelectric Power Plant Project was $165.9 million and it was financed according to a 70:30 debt-to-equity ratio. China Eximbank was the only lender for this project. Therefore, AidData assumes that the face value of the China Eximbank loan was $116.13 million. The borrowing terms of the loan were as follows: 6% interest rate, 4 year grace period, and 15 year maturity.   This project was implemented as an independent power project (IPP) on a build, own, operate and transfer (BOOT) model basis. Sinohydro-Sagarmatha Power Company (P) Ltd. signed a Power Purchase Agreement (PPA) with the Nepal Electricity Authority to provide annual power generation of approximately 317 million kWh. Sinohydro (later renamed PowerChina) was the EPC contractor responsible for project implementation. Construction began on January 8, 2013. This IPP reached its commercial operation date on January 1, 2017. Per the terms of the PPA, the NEA will off-take electricity at 6.95 Nepali rupees (Rs) per unit. The electricity produced by the Upper Marsyandgi A hydroelectric power plant will be connected to the transmission line of NEA located at Damauli. Each year, it is expected that the project will generate 317.6 million units of electricity including 57 million units between mid-December to mid-March in dry season and 260.6 million units in rainy season.
justification: Primary purpose is renewable energy generation through hydropower
evidence: 50 MW run-of-river hydroelectric power plant, renewable energy focus, expected annual generation of 317 million kWh

title: China Donates 1,280 tons rice to Niger (Linked to #58645)
description: On 5 July 2012, Chinese ambassador to Niger, Xia Huang, donated 1,182 tons of rice to address food insecurity in Niger. The Chinese donation is dedicated to reinforcing the country’s cereal stock which was depleted after poor harvests in 2011, through the filling of warehouses of the Niger Food Product Office (OPVN). This was financed under an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement signed earlier the same year (umbrella project #58645). --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 我对尼紧急粮援交接仪式在尼日尔举行 文章来源：驻尼日尔使馆经商处	2012-07-05 05:58	文章类型：原创 内容分类：新闻 　　2012年7月5日上午，驻尼日尔大使夏煌代表中国政府向尼政府移交总计1282吨的紧急粮食援助。使馆经商参赞史首建、尼总理办公厅主任西迪贝、外交部秘书长阿巴尼及相关尼政府官员、尼各主要媒体出席仪式。  　　在签字仪式上，夏大使和西迪贝主任分别发表讲话。夏大使表示，尼去年下半年以来遭受严重的粮食危机，中国人民感同身受，相信此批中国粮援有助于尼政府更好地应对粮荒，此举也是对尼政府力主的“粮食自给自足”倡议的大力支持和友好表示。夏大使同时指出，中非合作论坛第五届部长级会议召开在即，与包括尼在内的广大非洲国家的务实互利合作前景更为广阔。夏大使最后重申中方愿继续在力所能及范围内，帮助尼改善民生、促进经济社会发展。  　　西迪贝代表尼政府和人民真诚感谢中国政府的无私援助，表示中国是尼最值得信赖的朋友，每当尼遇到困难，中国总是义不容辞地伸出援手。中国在教育、卫生、饮用水、基础设施等多领域的对尼援助与合作，对尼发展至关重要，体现了尼中友好关系和两国人民间的珍贵友谊。
staff_comments: This is a duplicate of project #58590. 58590 has been deactivated as the duplicate.
combined_text:
# Sector
DEVELOPMENTAL FOOD AID/FOOD SECURITY ASSISTANCE

# Title
China Donates 1,280 tons rice to Niger (Linked to #58645)

# Description
On 5 July 2012, Chinese ambassador to Niger, Xia Huang, donated 1,182 tons of rice to address food insecurity in Niger. The Chinese donation is dedicated to reinforcing the country’s cereal stock which was depleted after poor harvests in 2011, through the filling of warehouses of the Niger Food Product Office (OPVN). This was financed under an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement signed earlier the same year (umbrella project #58645). --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 我对尼紧急粮援交接仪式在尼日尔举行 文章来源：驻尼日尔使馆经商处	2012-07-05 05:58	文章类型：原创 内容分类：新闻 　　2012年7月5日上午，驻尼日尔大使夏煌代表中国政府向尼政府移交总计1282吨的紧急粮食援助。使馆经商参赞史首建、尼总理办公厅主任西迪贝、外交部秘书长阿巴尼及相关尼政府官员、尼各主要媒体出席仪式。  　　在签字仪式上，夏大使和西迪贝主任分别发表讲话。夏大使表示，尼去年下半年以来遭受严重的粮食危机，中国人民感同身受，相信此批中国粮援有助于尼政府更好地应对粮荒，此举也是对尼政府力主的“粮食自给自足”倡议的大力支持和友好表示。夏大使同时指出，中非合作论坛第五届部长级会议召开在即，与包括尼在内的广大非洲国家的务实互利合作前景更为广阔。夏大使最后重申中方愿继续在力所能及范围内，帮助尼改善民生、促进经济社会发展。  　　西迪贝代表尼政府和人民真诚感谢中国政府的无私援助，表示中国是尼最值得信赖的朋友，每当尼遇到困难，中国总是义不容辞地伸出援手。中国在教育、卫生、饮用水、基础设施等多领域的对尼援助与合作，对尼发展至关重要，体现了尼中友好关系和两国人民间的珍贵友谊。

evidence: 1,280 tons of rice donated to address food insecurity, humanitarian aid focus

title: Chinese Government dispatches 17th medical team to National Hospital of Niamey, National Zinder Hospital, and Regional Hospital Center of Maradi (linked to #58578)
description: China has been sending medical teams to Niger from Guangxi Province since January 1976, and in May 2012, the Chinese Government and the Government of Niger signed a protocol agreement, dispatching the 17th medical team to Niger.  The 37-member team was was stationed at National Hospital of Niamey (l'Hôpital National de Niamey), the National Zinder Hospital (l'Hôpital National Zinder or Hopital Regional de Zinder), and Regional Hospital Center of Maradi (le Centre Hospitalier Régional de Maradi); and it completed its term of service between 2013 and 12 March, 2015.  This mission is linked to a medical supplies donation from the Chinese Government in January 2012 (see Project ID#58578).
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government dispatches 17th medical team to National Hospital of Niamey, National Zinder Hospital, and Regional Hospital Center of Maradi (linked to #58578)

# Description
China has been sending medical teams to Niger from Guangxi Province since January 1976, and in May 2012, the Chinese Government and the Government of Niger signed a protocol agreement, dispatching the 17th medical team to Niger.  The 37-member team was was stationed at National Hospital of Niamey (l'Hôpital National de Niamey), the National Zinder Hospital (l'Hôpital National Zinder or Hopital Regional de Zinder), and Regional Hospital Center of Maradi (le Centre Hospitalier Régional de Maradi); and it completed its term of service between 2013 and 12 March, 2015.  This mission is linked to a medical supplies donation from the Chinese Government in January 2012 (see Project ID#58578).
justification: Project focuses on healthcare services and medical support without direct environmental or energy transition implications
evidence: Medical team dispatch to hospitals, healthcare services provision
